text:
Clients fidèles de Giorgio à Rosemère, il est toujours agréable d'y retourner.

Personnel aimable et attentifs à nos désirs, choix de menus variés et abordables . Durant la belle saison, la terrasse extérieure est toujours très animée.

Nous avons eu une très mauvaise expérience pour le dîner.  Le plat principal qui arrive avant la soupe.  Puis, la soupe qui arrive froide.  Le repas revient mais c'est évident qu'il était sous un réchaud depuis ce temps là.  Et oui il était froid aussi.  C'étais sincèrement désagréable.  POURTANT et c'est l'important de mon commentaire. J'y vais depuis au moins 15 ans et la cuisine a toujours été fantastique pour souper.  C'étais peut-être une malchance, mais je n'ai pas osé réessayer.  L'accueil est bien, le personnel est souriant, le service est très bien et qualité/prix ça va aussi.  Finalement, j'aime bien que le cappuccino soit inclus. 
Mon plat préféré: La lasagne.

I was initially off put by our wait. We had made reservations, arrived on time,  but still had to wait. I figured i wouldn't get caught up on that since it was new years eve and they were probably experiencing a bigger rush than usual. The meal to follow was great and worth the wait. 

PROs
- Good food: I had a very tasty and original duck & fig pizza topped with sliced potato. I'm not 100% sure if all the ingredients but I consider myself very picky when it comes to pizza. This one had a combination of flavors and textures that did not disappoint
- Friendly staff: Our waitress was attentive and very enthusiastic
- Nice ambiance: I remember Giorgios as having a more rustic look. This one looked very modern. The layout made it a bit more private
- Every à la carte order comes with a cappuccino. I'm not usually one to order a cappuccino after a meal but the warm drink with a side of chocolate shavings made a great dinner sublime.

CONs
- Pricey: it follows the typical BYOW strategy of adding a few more dollars onto each plate because A) you feel like you saved on the wine B) Wine lowers inhibitions. Plates range from 17-28. Or maybe you are still paying for the cappuccino. 

- Bruscetta was a 6/10. Passable but poorly executed. It looked/tasted more like repurposed garlic bread.
